009package Ch19_DiscreteFourierTransform;
010
011import ij.ImagePlus;
012import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
013import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
014import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
015import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
016import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
017import imagingbook.spectral.dft.Dft2d;
018import imagingbook.spectral.dft.Dft2dDirect;
019import imagingbook.spectral.dft.Dft2dFast;
020import imagingbook.spectral.dft.ScalingMode;
021
022
023/**
024 * <p>
025 * This ImageJ plugin computes the 2-dimensional DFT (magnitude spectrum) from
026 * an image of arbitrary size using {@code float} or {@code double} data.
027 * Optionally, either a direct DFT or a fast FFT implementation is used. See
028 * Chapters 18-19 of [1] for additional details.
029 * </p>
030 * <p>
031 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic
032 * Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
033 * </p>
034 *
035 * @author WB
036 * @version 2022/10/23
037 */
038public class DFT_2D_Demo implements PlugInFilter {
039        
040        private static boolean ShowLogSpectrum = true;
041        private static boolean UseDoublePrecision = false;
042        private static boolean UseFastMode = true;
043        private static boolean CenterSpectrum = true;
044        private static boolean ReconstructImage = true;
045        
046        private ImagePlus im;
047        private int w, h;
048        private FloatProcessor reconstructionRe = null;
049        private FloatProcessor reconstructionIm = null;
050        
051        @Override
052        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus im) {
053                this.im = im;
054                return DOES_8G + DOES_32 + NO_CHANGES;
055        }
056
057        @Override
058        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
059                if (!runDialog()) 
060                        return;
061                
062                w = ip.getWidth();
063                h = ip.getHeight();
064                
065                FloatProcessor fp = ip.convertToFloatProcessor();       
066                FloatProcessor magSpectrum = (UseDoublePrecision) ? runDouble(fp) : runFloat(fp);
067                
068                if (ShowLogSpectrum) {
069                        magSpectrum.add(1.0);
070                        magSpectrum.log();
071                }
072                
073                magSpectrum.resetMinAndMax();
074                
075                if (CenterSpectrum) {   // strange this only works here (not before) - bug in Blitter?
076                        swapQuadrants(magSpectrum);
077                }
078                
079                String name = im.getShortTitle();
080                String title = (ShowLogSpectrum) ?
081                                name + "-DFT (log. magnitude)" : name + "-DFT (magnitude)";
082                new ImagePlus(title, magSpectrum).show();
083                
084                // show reconstructed image if available
085                if (ReconstructImage) {
086//                      reIp.resetMinAndMax();
087//                      imIp.resetMinAndMax();
088                        new ImagePlus(name + "-reconstructed (real part)", reconstructionRe).show();
089                        new ImagePlus(name + "-reconstructed (imag. part = zero!)", reconstructionIm).show();
090                }
091                
092        }
093        
094        private FloatProcessor runFloat(FloatProcessor fp) {
095                float[][] re = fp.getFloatArray();
096                float[][] im = new float[w][h];
097                
098                Dft2d.Float dft2 = (UseFastMode) ? 
099                                new Dft2dFast.Float(w, h, ScalingMode.DEFAULT) :
100                                new Dft2dDirect.Float(w, h, ScalingMode.DEFAULT);
101                
102                dft2.forward(re, im);
103                
104                float[][] mag = dft2.getMagnitude(re, im);
105                FloatProcessor ms = new FloatProcessor(mag);
106                
107                if (ReconstructImage) {
108                        dft2.inverse(re, im);
109                        this.reconstructionRe = new FloatProcessor(re);
110                        this.reconstructionIm = new FloatProcessor(im);
111                }
112                
113                return ms;
114        }
115        
116        private FloatProcessor runDouble(FloatProcessor fp) {
117                double[][] re = Matrix.toDouble(fp.getFloatArray());
118                double[][] im = new double[w][h];
119                
120                Dft2d.Double dft2 = (UseFastMode) ? 
121                                new Dft2dFast.Double(w, h, ScalingMode.DEFAULT) :
122                                new Dft2dDirect.Double(w, h, ScalingMode.DEFAULT);
123                
124                dft2.forward(re, im);
125                
126                double[][] mag = dft2.getMagnitude(re, im);
127                FloatProcessor ms = new FloatProcessor(Matrix.toFloat(mag));
128                
129                if (ReconstructImage) {
130                        dft2.inverse(re, im);
131                        this.reconstructionRe = new FloatProcessor(Matrix.toFloat(re));
132                        this.reconstructionIm = new FloatProcessor(Matrix.toFloat(im));
133                }
134                
135                return ms;
136        }
137        // -------------------------------------------------------------
138        
139        private boolean runDialog() {
140                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(getClass().getSimpleName());
141                gd.addCheckbox("Use fast mode (FFT)", UseFastMode);
142                gd.addCheckbox("Use double precision", UseDoublePrecision);
143                gd.addCheckbox("Show logarithmic spectrum", ShowLogSpectrum);
144                gd.addCheckbox("Center spectrum", CenterSpectrum);
145                gd.addCheckbox("Reconstruct image", ReconstructImage);
146                
147                gd.showDialog(); 
148                if (gd.wasCanceled()) 
149                        return false;
150                
151                UseFastMode = gd.getNextBoolean();
152                UseDoublePrecision = gd.getNextBoolean();
153                ShowLogSpectrum = gd.getNextBoolean();
154                CenterSpectrum = gd.getNextBoolean();
155                ReconstructImage = gd.getNextBoolean();
156                return true;
157        }
158        
159        // -------------------------------------------------------------
160        
161        /**
162         * Centers a 2D DFT spectrum.
163         * Modifies the given image by moving the origin of the image to its center
164         * (circularly).
165         * TODO: Check for possible bug when applied to a {@link FloatProcessor}!
166         * 
167         * @param ip an {@link ImageProcessor} instance
168         */
169        private void swapQuadrants(ImageProcessor ip) {
170                // swap quadrants Q1 <-> Q3, Q2 <-> Q4
171                // Q2 Q1
172                // Q3 Q4
173                ImageProcessor t1, t2;
174                int w = ip.getWidth();
175                int h = ip.getHeight();
176                int wc = w / 2;
177                int hc = h / 2;
178
179                ip.setRoi(wc, 0, w - wc, hc); // Q1
180                t1 = ip.crop();
181                ip.setRoi(0, hc, wc, h - hc); // Q3
182                t2 = ip.crop();
183
184                ip.insert(t1, 0, hc); // swap Q1 <-> Q3
185                ip.insert(t2, wc, 0);
186
187                ip.setRoi(0, 0, wc, hc); // Q2
188                t1 = ip.crop();
189                ip.setRoi(wc, hc, w - wc, h - hc); // Q4
190                t2 = ip.crop();
191
192                ip.insert(t1, wc, hc);
193                ip.insert(t2, 0, 0);
194        }
195
196}
